docs.title: prefect-sns
docs.text: Prefect block for integration with AWS SNS

docs.title: Resources
docs.text: For more tips on how to use tasks and flows in a Collection, check out Using Collections!

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
Install prefect-sns with pip:

pip install prefect-sns

Requires an installation of Python 3.7+.

We recommend using a Python virtual environment manager such as pipenv, conda or virtualenv.

These tasks are designed to work with Prefect 2.0. For more information about how to use Prefect, please refer to the Prefect documentation.

docs.title: Feedback
docs.text:
If you encounter any bugs while using prefect-sns, feel free to open an issue in the prefect-sns repository.

If you have any questions or issues while using prefect-sns, you can find help in either the Prefect Discourse forum or the Prefect Slack community.

Feel free to star or watch prefect-sns for updates too!

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
If you'd like to help contribute to fix an issue or add a feature to prefect-sns, please propose changes through a pull request from a fork of the repository.

Here are the steps:

  1. Fork the repository
  2. Clone the forked repository
  3. Install the repository and its dependencies: 
    pip install -e ".[dev]"
  4. Make desired changes
  5. Add tests
  6. Insert an entry to CHANGELOG.md
  7. Install pre-commit to perform quality checks prior to commit: 
    pre-commit install
  8. git commit, git push, and create a pull request

docs.title: Blocks Catalog
docs.text:
Below is a list of Blocks available for registration in prefect-sns.

To register blocks in this module to view and edit them on Prefect Cloud, first install the required packages, then 

prefect block register -m prefect_sns
Note, to use the load method on Blocks, you must already have a block document saved through code or saved through the UI.

docs.title: Blocks Module
docs.text:
SnsBlock

A block that facilitates interaction with AWS SNS.

To load the SnsBlock: 

from prefect import flow
from prefect_sns.blocks import SnsBlock

@flow
def my_flow():
    my_block = SnsBlock.load("MY_BLOCK_NAME")

my_flow()
For additional examples, check out the Blocks Module under Examples Catalog.

docs.title: Examples Catalog
docs.text: Below is a list of examples for prefect-sns.

docs.title: Blocks Module
docs.text:
Load a stored value: 

from prefect_sns import SnsBlock
block = SnsBlock.load("BLOCK_NAME")
block.publish("my subject", "my message")

docs.title: hello_and_goodbye
docs.text:
Sample flow that says hello and goodbye!

Source code in prefect_sns/flows.py 
@flow
def hello_and_goodbye():
"""
    Sample flow that says hello and goodbye!
    """
    SnsBlock.seed_value_for_example()
    block = SnsBlock.load("sample-block")

    print(hello_prefect_sns())
    print(f"The block's value: {block.sns_arn}")
    print(goodbye_prefect_sns())
    return "Done"

docs.title: goodbye_prefect_sns
docs.text:
Sample task that says goodbye!

Returns:

Type Description str

A farewell for your collection

Source code in prefect_sns/tasks.py 
@task
def goodbye_prefect_sns() -> str:
"""
    Sample task that says goodbye!

    Returns:
        A farewell for your collection
    """
    return "Goodbye, prefect-sns!"

docs.text:

Returns:

Type Description str

A greeting for your collection

@task
def hello_prefect_sns() -> str:
"""
    Sample task that says hello!

    Returns:
        A greeting for your collection
    """
    return "Hello, prefect-sns!"
